title.narrative: Niger: Smart Villages for rural growth and digital inclusion

description.narrative: The project aims to increase access to cellphone and broadband services in rural areas and to bring digital financial services to selected underserved areas.

condition.narrative: Prior to implementing Parts C.1(a), C.1(c), and C.2(b) of the Project, the Recipient shall, and shall cause the PIE to, prepare, inaccordance with terms of reference acceptable to the Association, and furnish to the Association a grant manual (“Grant Manual”) inform and substance acceptable to the Association, containing, inter alia: (a) detailed arrangements and procedures relating to theDigital Center Subgrants and Digital Center Subprojects financed under Part C.1(a) of the Project; (b) detailed arrangements andprocedures relating to the Payment Device Vouchers financed under Part C.1(c) of the Project; (c) detailed arrangements andprocedures relating to the Fintech Subgrants for Selected Fintech Companies financed under Part C.2(b) of the Project; and (d)mechanisms for the monitoring and evaluating of the work performed by Digital Center Beneficiaries, Service Providers, and SelectedFintech Companies.

The PIE shall, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, (i) recruit an internal auditor and an accountingassistant, each of whose qualifications, experience and terms of reference shall be satisfactory to the Association and (ii)acquire an adequate accounting information system.

The Recipient shall, and shall cause the PIE to, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, prepare, in accordancewith terms of reference acceptable to the Association, and furnish to the Association an implementation manual for the Project(“Project Implementation Manual” and/or “PIM”), in form and substance acceptable to the Association, containing, inter alia,detailed arrangements and procedures in connection to: (a) implementation of the Project; (b) administrative; (c) procurement; (d)environmental and social safeguards; (e) financial management and accounting; (f) monitoring and evaluation; (g) grievancemechanism for the Project; ; and (h) and other such technical, administrative, fiduciary or coordination arrangements as may benecessary to ensure effective Project implementation.

The Recipient shall, and shall cause the Project Implementing Entity to, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date,establish and thereafter maintain, throughout Project implementation, and publicize the availability of, Project grievancemechanisms, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association, to receive and address fairly and in good faith all complaintsraised in relation to the Project and take all measures necessary to implement the determinations made by such grievance mechanismin a manner satisfactory to the Association.

The Recipient shall, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, establish and thereafter maintain, throughout theProject implementation period, with composition, mandate and resources satisfactory to the Association, a steering committee, to bechaired by the Director General of the National Agency of Society Information (“ANSI”) (or an authorized representative),co-chaired by a representative of the Recipient's Ministry for Posts, Telecommunications and the Digital Economy (“MPTEN”) and arepresentative of the Recipient's Ministry of Finance and to be comprised of representatives from the Recipient's Ministry ofPlanning and Economic Development, Ministry of Agriculture, Ministry of Commerce, and representatives of the BCEAO and CAIMA(“Project Steering Committee”). To this end, the Recipient shall ensure that the Steering Committee is responsible for reviewingProject progress reports, endorsing strategic guidance and overall oversight of the Project and validating the Annual Work Plan andBudget for the Project.

The Recipient shall, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, establish and thereafter maintain, throughout theProject implementation period, with composition, mandate and resources satisfactory to the Association, a technical committee, tobe chaired by the Project coordinator and to be comprised of representatives of mobile operators, regulator, representatives fromsectoral ministries participating in the Project Steering Committee, a representative from the Ministry of Energy, electricitycompanies, and financial institutions (“Project Technical Committee”).
